stocks.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 19th
stocks.news:
Wayfair Gets A Reality Check:

Home decor company Wayfair (W -13.02%) announced its first sales gain, up 5.1%, since 2020.

But its shares dropped over 15% on the news. Why? Investors are worried the company's expansion plans are risky. With home sales low and tariffs high, consumers are buying less furniture at cheaper prices.

The New Sales King:

Amazon just took the #1 spot for world's biggest company by sales, beating out Walmart.

Amazon Web Services (AWS), the cloud-computing arm of the company, had its fastest growth in years thanks to AI.

Why it matters? Both companies sell low-cost items to consumers, and Walmart has attracted high-income shoppers in recent years.

economy.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 19th
economy.commentary:
Labor Market Holds Steady:

Jobless claims came in lower than expected ‚Äî a sign that the labor market is holding up.

Well, kind of ‚Äî there haven't been a lot of layoffs but there also isn't a lot of hiring.

Economists say the current labor market is unusual, because GDP is growing, but lots of jobs aren't being created.

crypto.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 19th
crypto.commentary:
White House Works On Deal:

The White House is working with banks to agree on a deal regarding stablecoins.

What's going on? Banks don't want stablecoins to be able to offer yields ‚Äî or interest.

Bank executives say that if users are able to get interest for holding stablecoins, it could disrupt the entire banking system.

The White House says it has made progress, but a deal hasn't been made yet.

real_estate.homebuilder:
Commercial Deal in Santa Clara:

First Washington Realty recently acquired Mission Park Marketplace in Santa Clara for $20.33MM ‚Äî a sign that commercial real estate investment in the Bay Area continues to move despite broader market uncertainty.
real_estate.commentary:
üìç Fremont (Strong Buyer Activity)

Fremont's housing market is seeing strong buyer activity early in the year, with homes selling in a median of 21 days as inventory remains tight.

Latest Real Estate News in the Bay Area:

Fremont is kicking off the year with solid momentum as buyers return to the market due to stabilizing rates, and pending sales are showing significant activity. In the commercial sector, Bloom Energy is doubling down on its Fremont presence by consolidating operations in the East Bay and exiting a 104,000 sq. ft. space on the Peninsula. Over in Santa Clara County, the market remains firmly in "seller's market" territory despite earlier economic concerns.

Latest General News in the Bay Area:

In Milpitas, the community is bidding a fond farewell to Koong's, a beloved Chinese restaurant that officially closed after operating for more than four decades. Regionally, BART is warning of a massive budget crisis that could lead to the closure of 15 stations and slashed services without the approval of a voter-backed sales tax.
